resources.string: Invalid weight, weight must be a whole number (weight in lbs)
Invalid amount, amount must be a whole number
Invalid value, value must be a whole number (value in copper pieces)
Invalid damage, damage must be a dice string (example: 2d6)
Invalid AC value, AC should be a whole number
Invalid max DEX, max DEX should be a whole number
Invalid armor penalty, penalty should be a whole number
Invalid crit multiplier, multiplier should be a whole number
Item attribute invalid, please check input

Changes to the Score values will be saved and be available on future app runs. Temp Score values will not be saved. Temp Score values should be used for temporary attribute changes like attribute damage or buffs.

You can tap the values under Temp Mod to see how they are calculated (Score, Temp Score, item bonuses, etc). These values are used throughout the app to calculate your other stats.
You can tap the stat values to see a popup explaining how this value is calculated. This can be used on most values throughout the app.

Tap a skill to add skill ranks to it when you have skill ranks available. Skill ranks are made available upon leveling up based on your character class and intelligence bonus. You can undo adding a skill rank to a skill by long pressing it.

Green coloured skills indicate class skills.

You can tap the skill bonus number to see how the skill bonus is calculated.

Tap a feat to expand it and read the description. You can add feats by clicking the Add button whenever you have available feats (generally after level up). If you want to undo adding a feat you can long press the feat.

To add a feat, click the Add button and tap the feat to expand it. You can now tap the Select button to add the feat to your character. You can also filter the feats list by using the Find textbox.

You can add items to your inventory by clicking the Add button. This pops up the Add New Item dialog. This allows you to input the item details. Only the name is mandatory. When multiple items with the same name are added to the inventory they are automatically stacked.

You can (un)equip wearable items by tapping the item name to expand it and then tap the Equip button. You can discard an item from your inventory with the Discard button. Equipping an item means the item stats are automatically factored into your various derived stats (armor class, damage, attributes, etc).

Item values:
Weight: in lbs, default 0
Value: in copper pieces, default 0
Amount: number of items, default 1
Item type: select from the list
Magic bonus: select the type from the list and put in the bonus amount in the text box next to it

Armor
AC: armor class, default 0
MaxDex: Maximum dexterity value for this armor, default 99
Penalty: Armor penalty, usually a negative number, default 0

Weapon
Damage: dice string like 1d12 or 2d8
Critical range: Select critical range from the list
Critical multiplier: critical multiplier
Damage type: optional, default blank

You can toggle rage on and off. This automatically adjusts your stats for the various rage bonuses (and penalties).

Every other level after the 1st the barbarian can pick one rage power. You can open the rage selection dialog by tapping the Add button. This button is only visible when you can choose a rage power, for example after leveling up. In this dialog you can add a rage power to your character by tapping rage power name to expand it, then tap the Select button.

To undo adding a rage power, tap the rage power to expand it, then long press the description of the rage power.
You can set your character\'s wealth in copper pieces and your character\'s experience points.

You can open the spell selection dialog by tapping the Add button. This button is only visible when you can add new spells to your collection, for example after leveling up. In the dialog you can add a spell power to your character by tapping spell name to expand it, then tap the Select button.

To undo adding a spell, tap the spell to expand it, then long press the description of the spell.

Important!
Please keep in mind the following caveats:
1 - Currently there is no check to see if a character is allowed to add a specific spell. It is up to you to add spells according to the game rules.
2 - Cleric domain arcane spells are not included in this list
3 - While the \'Available spells\' counter is correct in terms of the total number, in the game rules this number consists of a certain amount of level 0 spells, level 1 spells, level 2 spells, etc. Please add the spells accordingly. Also see item 1 of this list.
4 - Wizard spell lists include all level 0 spells, even ones from prohibited schools. Keep this in mind if your wizard character is specialized in one school of magic.
